node.label: Service
node.description: This is a service type

node.label: Similarity And Homology
node.description: Services related to the comparison of sequences

node.label: runPSIBlast
node.description: Compares a protein sequence to a sequence database and calculates the statistical significance of matches using the Position Specific Iterative BLAST PSIBLAST

node.label: getAminoAcidSequenceUMA
node.description: Get a GenBank aminoacid sequence from an ID from any database even PDB

node.label: Homology Search And Phylogenetic Study
node.description: When a researcher has one amino acid query sequence it is interesting to search for similar sequences with a common evolutive history Later we can follow the study comparing the query sequence with others and searching for these evolutive relations This workflow run a homology search and performs a phylogenetic study To do that it run several services all of them located at INB registry getAminoAcidSequence It takes the ID ID or ACC of a amino acid sequence and namespace protein database SwissProt or UniProt inputs and returns a aminoacid sequence The service output is showed as workflow output and also links with the next service runNCBIBlastp It runs a BlastP homology search using a protein database with the previous sequence and reports the output and links with the next service getBestHitsFromBlast It takes the best hits from the Blast report using a secondary parameter as a Evalue threshold This value is fixed to The output is a collection of Object each with an IDACC and namespace database name getAminoAcidSequenceCollection This service takes a Object collection with IdNamespace pairs and retrieves its corresponding amino acid sequences The output showed for the workflow is the list of retrieved sequences runClustalwFast It runs the Clustalw algorithm with the retrieved sequences to build a multiple alignments This alignment contains the sequence similarity among the analysis sequences runCreateTreeFromClustalw Finally the relations obtained with the multiple alignment are used to build a phylogenetic tree with Newick format This tree will be useful to study the evolutionary relationships of all retrieved sequences

node.label: runNCBIBlastp1
node.description: Run NCBIBlast with default parameters from a fasta file

node.label: runWUTBlastx
node.description: It compares the sixframe translations of a nucleotide query sequence against the sixframe translations of a nucleotide sequence database using the Washington University BLAST algorithm

node.label: runClustalwFast
node.description: ClustalW multiple sequence alignments fast method

node.label: runNCBITBlastx
node.description: Compares the sixframe translations of a nucleotide query sequence against the sixframe translations of a nucleotide sequence database and calculates the statistical significance of matches using the Basic Local Alignment Search Tool BLAST

node.label: runWUTBlastn
node.description: It compares an amino acid query sequence against the sixframe translations of a nucleotide sequence database using the Washington University BLAST algorithm

node.label: runNCBITBlastn_2Seqs
node.description: Compares a protein sequence against a nucleotide sequence used as a database dynamically translated in all six reading frames both strands using the Basic Local Alignment Tool BLAST

node.label: runClustalwFull
node.description: ClustalW multiple sequence alignments full method

node.label: runPSIBlastpFromAminoAcidSequence
node.description: Perform iterations of protein PSI Blast against nonredundant database with standard settings

node.label: runNCBITBlastn
node.description: Compares an amino acid sequence against the sixframe translations of a nucleotide sequence database and calculates the statistical significance of matches using the Basic Local Alignment Search Tool BLAST

node.label: getAminoAcidSequenceCollection
node.description: Retrieves an AminoAcidSequence collection from an Object idID or AC namespacedatabase collection

node.label: runClustalwFastUMA
node.description: Run a clustal from a collection of generic sequences

node.label: runWUBlastn
node.description: It compares a nucleotide query sequence against a nucleotide sequence database using the Washington University BLAST algorithm

node.label: runHSP
node.description: HSP workflow deployed on RISC cloud

node.label: Phenotype Genotype
node.description: Look for relationship between data coming from phenotype and particular genes or expression

node.label: Annotation
node.description: Set of tools to give extra information from databases to an specific sequence

node.label: sma3sv2
node.description: Smas allows the user discovering important information about an interestin sequence when other traditional methods fail Smas retrieve annotations from keywords pathways go terms interactions and orthologous in other species if any
